class.name: wxCollapsiblePane
class.description: A collapsible pane is a container with an embedded button-like control which can be used by the user to collapse or expand the pane's contents.

flag.name: wxCP_DEFAULT_STYLE
flag.description: The default style. It includes wxTAB_TRAVERSAL and wxBORDER_NONE.

flag.name: wxCP_NO_TLW_RESIZE
flag.description: By default wxCollapsiblePane resizes the top level window containing it when its own size changes. This allows to easily implement dialogs containing an optionally shown part, for example, and so is the default behaviour but can be inconvenient in some specific cases -- use this flag to disable this automatic parent resizing then.

bool.name: collapsed
bool.label: Collapsed
bool.description: Should the pane be collapsed initially (default: 0)?

type.name: wxEVT_COMMAND_COLLPANE_CHANGED
type.description: The user expanded or collapsed the collapsible pane.

class.name: panewindow
class.description: wxCollapsiblePane may contain single optional child object of the panewindow pseudo-class type. panewindow itself must contain exactly one child that is a sizer or a non-toplevel window object.
